intro: Mocquerysia multiflora, commonly known as the Andean wax tree, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It is characterized by its dense, wax-covered leaves that provide protection against intense sunlight and cold temperatures. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers in clusters, typically blooming in the spring. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes other shrubs and trees adapted to acidic soils. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often found in cloud forests and is valued for its ornamental qualities.
